addPayload

public void addPayload(java.lang.Object payload)
Add (or replace) a payload to the message. If the payload doesn't match

Parameters:

createPingMessageMessage

public static Message createPingMessageMessage(int srcId)
Convenience routine to create a ping message

Parameters:
srcId - the id of the source
Returns:
a Message with type MessageType.PING. These are initiated by clients, not the server. The destinationId is matched to the sourceId causing the message to make a round trip--exactly what you want.

createHandshakeMessage

public static Message createHandshakeMessage(int srcId,
                                             int destId)
Convenience routine to create a handshake message

Parameters:
srcId - the id of the source
destId - the id of the destination
Returns:
a message of type Message.HANDSHAKE

getString

public java.lang.String getString()
Get the payload as a String, if it is a String

Returns:
the payload as a single String object.

getSourceId

public int getSourceId()
Get the Id of the source. The server itself has an Id of zero.

Returns:
the sourceId

getDestinationId

public int getDestinationId()
Get the Id of the destination. The server itself has an Id of zero.

Returns:
the destinationId

getMessageType

public MessageType getMessageType()
Get the type of the message

Returns:
the messageType

getDataType

public DataType getDataType()
Get the type of data we are delivering. Might be NODDATA for dataless messages)

Returns:
the dataType. Specifies what type of array will follow in the payload.

getUser1

public short getUser1()
Get the optional user1 value. This is reserved for application specific data.

Returns:
the user1 value.

getUser2

public short getUser2()
Get the optional user2 value. This is reserved for application specific data.

Returns:
the user2 value.

isSwap

public boolean isSwap()
If true, the bytes were swapped when creating this header from a read of a DataInputStream.

Returns:
true if the header required a swap to match the magic word. If so, the payload will require swapping too.

getDataLength

public int getDataLength()
Get the length of the payload data array. This is not a byte count but an entry count. E.g., if the payload is a int array with two entries, this should return 2.

Returns:
the length of the data array.

invert

public void invert()
This method exchanges the source and destination. It is convenient for messages like handshakes and pings.
